page.title: 05THE COMMUNITY CENTRE, CORBY.
page.content: Lodge Park Community Centre serves Lodge Park area. Built in 1968, it is run & financed by the District Council. Facilities include a hall to seat 70 people, a committee room, a kitchen, a toilet for the disabled & a storage area. Every week the centre is used by different groups: the under 5's playgroup, every weekday 1.5 hrs., mothers' and children's One O'Clock Club, two hrs. twice weekly, Kung Fu one evening and various dance clubs, ballroom, ballet and tap. Some Saturday evenings there are wedding receptions, socials, discos and private parties. A useful social centre; but not for teenagers. To them it offers little. So, as pubs and fields are out-of- bounds, clubs are for adults and parks mainly for footballers and dog-walkers, many seek solace in pop-culture, T.V. or mischief.
